documentation.xhtml: The config manager (to load/save/activate configuration data)
The West controller at the dome to control the temperature
The West controller at the first floor to control the temperature
The West controller at the pumps room to control the temperature
The West controller at the heat exchanger to control the oil temperature
Change the operating state (e.g. AUTO, MANUAL, ...)
Change the operating state (e.g. AUTO, MANUAL, ...)
Is the data valid and within range?
Is the data valid and within range?
Are the WESTs in healthy state (good) or not (bad)
Are the WESTs being polled (auto) or not (manual)?
Is the I/O in a healthy state?
Number of leap seconds, so that UTC = TAI + this value. See ftp://maia.usno.navy.mil/ser7/tai-utc.dat for the latest number.
Delta UT (= UT1 - UTC). Put to 0.0 to ignore.
If TRUE, then the local clock (source=LOCAL_CLOCK) will be used even if an external (more accurate!) clock is available
Don't show the Servicestiming status as ERROR in case the serial link fails
Config for the wind speed minimum
Config for the wind speed average
Config for the wind speed maximum
Config for the wind direction minimum
Config for the wind direction average
Config for the wind direction maximum
Config for the rain peak intensity
Config for the hail peak intensity
Config for the 3.5 V reference voltage
The time to change the setpoint, as decimal hour (e.g. 9.5 = 9:30 am)
Setpoint = air temperature of meteo station + this offset (in degrees celsius)
True to automatically update the setpoint
Minimum setpoint when the PLC updates the value
Time between bus reads in seconds
The address of the Dome temperature controller
The address of the first floor temperature controller
The address of the pumps room temperature controller
The address of the oil heat exchanger temperature controller
The config for the temperature setpoint
Editable configuration of the Services subsystem
Active configuration of the Services subsystem
Is the dome open or closed?

ST.xhtml: initialize := THIS^.processes.initialize.request();
lock := THIS^.processes.lock.request();
unlock := THIS^.processes.unlock.request();
changeOperatingState := THIS^.processes.changeOperatingState.request( state := state );

documentation.xhtml: Name of this function block instance
Buffer to write all logging to
Temporary buffer to write logging by parts (sub-statemachines) to

ST.xhtml: THIS^.parts.timing._log( name := 'timing', buffer := subBuffer); THIS^.parts.meteo._log( name := 'meteo', buffer := subBuffer); THIS^.parts.west._log( name := 'west', buffer := subBuffer); THIS^.parts.io._log( name := 'io', buffer := subBuffer); THIS^.parts.configManager._log( name := 'configManager', buffer := subBuffer); LOGGER( name := name, actualStatus := THIS^.actualStatus, previousStatus := THIS^.previousStatus, buffer := buffer, subBuffer := subBuffer, pHealthStatus := ADR(THIS^.statuses.healthStatus), pBusyStatus := ADR(THIS^.statuses.busyStatus));
